contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox power station | name = Zaporizhia Nuclear Power Station | official_name = Запорізька АЕС | image = Kernkraftwerk Saporischschja.JPG | image_size = | image_caption = The six units of the Zaporizhia NPP. | image_alt = | location_map = Ukraine | location_map_width = | location_map_text = | lat_d = 47 | lat_m = 30 | lat_s = 44 | lat_NS = N | long_d = 34 | long_m = 35 | long_s = 09 | long_EW = E | coordinates_type = region:UA_type:landmark | coordinates_display= inline,title | coordinates_ref = | country = [[Ukraine]] | locale = [[Enerhodar]] | status = O | construction_began = 1981 | commissioned = 1985 | licence_expires = | decommissioned = | cost = | owner = [[Energoatom]] | operator = | developer = | constructor = | reactors_operate_mw= 6 × 1,000 [[MWe]] | reactors_const_mw = | reactors_planned_mw= | reactors_decom_mw = | reactors_cancel_mw = | reactor_type = [[VVER]] | reactor_supplier = [[Mintyazhmash]] | turbine_manu_npp = [[Electrotyazhmash]] | installed_capacity = 6,000 [[MWe]] | max_planned_cap = | capacity_factor = | average_annual_gen = | net_generation = | website = | as_of = 21 November 2010 | extra = }} The '''Zaporizhia Nuclear Power Station''' ({{lang-uk|Запорізька АЕС}}) in [[Ukraine]] is the largest [[nuclear power plant]] in [[Europe]] and [[List of largest power stations in the world|the fifth largest]] in the world. The plant is located in Central Ukraine near the city of [[Enerhodar]], on the banks of the [[Kakhovka Reservoir]] on the [[Dnieper]] river. It has 6 [[VVER|VVER-1000]] [[Pressurized water reactor|pressurized light water nuclear reactors]], each generating 1000 [[MWe]], for a total power output of 6,000 MWe.<ref>[http://www.industcards.com/nuclear-lt-ua.htm Nuclear Power Plants in Lithuania & Ukraine]</ref> The first five were successively brought online between 1985 and 1989, and the sixth was added in 1995. The plant generates about half of the country's electricity derived from nuclear power and more than a fifth of total [[electricity]] generated in Ukraine. {{Clear}} == See also == {{Portal|Ukraine}} {{Portal|Nuclear technology}} {{Portal|Energy}} * [[Enerhodar Dnipro Powerline Crossing]] * [[List of power stations in Ukraine]] * [[Threat of the Dnieper reservoirs]] * [[Zaporizhzhia thermal power station|Zaporozika DRES]] == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.energoatom.kiev.ua/en/nuclear_plants/npp_zp/info History of ZNPP] * [http://www.npp.zp.ua/ Official site of Zaporizhzhia NPP] * [http://www.insc.anl.gov/neisb/neisb4/NEISB_3.3.A5.html Information about the plant from INSC website] * [http://maps.google.com/?ll=47.511809,34.586678&spn=0.043538,0.069523&t=k&om=1 Satellite photo from Google Maps] [[Category:Nuclear power stations built in the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Nuclear power stations in Ukraine]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Zaporizhia Oblast]] [[Category:Nuclear power stations using VVER reactors]]
